attributes.action: Ban gazumping in the housing market
attributes.additional_details: Currently in England and Wales, it is possible to agree to the purchase of a property, and invest money in surveys and legal fees (not to mention time and emotional energy), only for another seller to come in with a higher bid and the sale is lost, along with any costs incurred i.e. "gazumping". This needs to stop.
attributes.background: In Scotland, acceptance of an offer to buy a property is legally binding and requires the payment of a deposit. I am looking for the law to be changed in England and Wales in the same manner.

rejection.details:
The following petition calls for a similar action: 

Introduce conveyancing laws similar to those in Scotland, across England & Wales
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/709395
